intro: Garnotia mezii var. longiramosa, commonly known as the long-stemmed garnotia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features narrow, elongated leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
